text: Courteous,  helpful staff. Good place to shop for lawn equipment,  appliances,  tools, and other sears merchandise .  Prices reasonable.

name: gabrielle basco
text: Very helpful got a great deal on washer and dryer will definitely buy more here

name: Gordon Daszczuk
text: Nice looking store. Good help here.

name: David M Payne
text: Great little store.  Had the exact tools I went in for.

name: Tammy Worthington
text: The staff here is very knolgeble and helpful in helping you choose appliances for your house remodels. They is always a deal to be found.

name: Peg Aldrich
text: Luv the staff.  Very accommodating.

name: Patricia O'Donnell
text: Thanks for the great service Eric!

name: Brittany Donnan
text: Great customer  service very friendly staff

name: Tony Weaver
text: Locally owned and you get personal friendly service.

name: Kristin Willis
text: I ordered a washer online and picked it up on a Thursday. Once we got it home and took it out of the box we noticed that the front of it was caved in. We called Sears and they told us to bring it back up there. They wouldn't do any kind of scratch and dent discount or I would have took it right back home. Instead they ordered another one and said it would be there the following Tuesday & that they would deliver it for free. Come Tuesday still no washer in and they said they would call me back to let me know when it was supposed to be in and I never received a call. That next Monday I finally received a call that my washer was in but couldn't be delivered until the following day. I ended up going and picking it up bc I was tired of having to wash my clothes in the sink. I will never get anything from there again!!!

resp.text: Kristin, I am the District manager for this area, Please provide your contact info so we can discuss the incident in detail. We strive to provide the best customer service as we are locally owned and operated. We want to make sure that we learn from every experience and meet your expectations.

name: Angie Boutwell
text: Great staff!  Service with a smile!

name: David Lloyd
text: Friendly folks with a good product selection.

name: Bruna Torres
text: Very satisfying on service from Foley Alabama associates in store

name: Greg Werner
text: Knowledge of products point on and delivery within days sometimes same day.

name: David Edwards
text: Great, personal shopping experience with these folks.

name: Cristy Cowan
text: Small store nice staff

name: Christopher McKinley
text: Terrible customer service. The new owner is worst than the last. If you buy a product here DO NOT expect them to honor the warranty!

resp.text: Hello Christopher,  please provide contact information and details about your experience. Most product has a limited manufacturers warranty which may impact our ability to provide support at store level. However, we may be able to contact the manufacturer on your behalf. Thank you.

name: John McCoy
text: Very friendly.

name: Alex Richardson
text: Nice store.

name: Elizabeth Teresa Castellanos
text: Friendly and courteous service

name: Frank Geiger
text: They were very helpful

name: BonnieS Carter
text:
It's always clean!!
And the people who work there are so helpful as well.   They dont mind one bit helping you locate a product.  And the people they have working in the store near me on Bailey Cove Rd., they are the sweetest people.   Some have even become friends. Some will stop what they're doing just to go out of their way to make sure they speak to you.  We love our neighborhood wall market, we only go to super Walmart now if we Absolutely have to.

name: Timothy Wyant
text: Nice clean location... very friendly staff...

name: Jarrod N
text: Definitely one of the better Walmarts in the area. Nice and clean. I always come looking for Pokémon cards and while they don’t usually have them, it’s very easy to walk over and see if they do, due to there being a dedicated card aisle on the right side of the store. Also has two different self checkout aisles that make the process a whole lot easier!

name: Meghan Kenny
text: Got an excellent vaccine here. Have not gotten covid but I do see a paper clip in my peripheral vision asking if I need help with my word document. Microsoft!!!!!

name: John Muhlhauser
text: Such a great and convenient place.  The location is absolutely perfect.  Everything is always well stocked.

name: Jeremy (J.O.)
text: Use to frequent this location more when I lived in the area. Stopped by to grab a few items. In and out. No problems. And the cashier lady was super friendly. Pleasant surprise.

name: Shalayne Palmer
text: I love this neighborhood Walmart although there could be better help with self checkout but they are friendly and very helpful. They always have a nice variety of things as well.

name: Chicken John
text: What I like about it is it is easy to find what you need because it's smaller. But because it's smaller there is less to buy, which defeats the purpose of Walmart. This is just more of a Kroger in my opinion. It does help that there is a larger Walmart nearby though. However I do love the staff, I left my change in the self checkout and they stopped me to hand it to me instead of being to lazy to bother.

name: Reb Kat
text: I like this neighborhood market because it is always clean and very well stocked

name: Belinda Montgomery
text: Very clean store and always good selection of groceries. Staff is very knowledgeable and clean plus very kind

name: Shirley Saare
text: Great place to shop staff friendly and helpful . Check out quick  with plenty of registers open to check out.

name: Samuel Hunt
text: This is a gem of a place. They have a very nice selection of gluten free baking items, well-priced organic options, and a wide selection of items for the health-conscious individual. I was pleasantly surprised to discover many items I cannot find anywhere else at great prices. I commend the management team for a job well done. I have never had a long wait at checkout either. I typically shun wal-mart because of low-quality products, but this market is outstanding. It is at the top of my list to find healthy, organic, gluten free products that even Kroger or the health foid store may not carry. VERY WELL MANAGED STORE.

name: Rachel Ivey
text: My produce ended up not being the freshest, and I noticed the prices were a bit higher than other grocery stores (including other Walmart's, I think.) Not sure if it's an increase in cost and I'm just now becoming aware, or if it's due to this being a neighborhood walmart as opposed to a super walmart; or maybe even it's location...?

name: Billy Martin
text: Good service cardio sales people always are shop there many times always good service usually have what you need

name: Kent White
text: Got my Moderna vaccine through the pharmacy.  Very friendly and knowledgeable staff.

name: Osking 32
text: Offer delivery's too tru the walmart app.

name: Mystique Harrison
text: Just meh. Didnt have what I was looking for but would serve most grocery needs.

name: Susan
text: Who ever does the ordering needs to do a better job.  They are constantly out of items, and I'm not talking about essential items.  Not sure why they can't keep their items stocked like other stores.

name: Orlando Fabre
text: Nice,  clean  and good service...way to go!

name: Judy Kim
text: Smaller, friendlier version of Big Walmart, which I have sworn off.

name: Lady K
text: Still Walmart, but more pleasant feeling for a quick run in.

name: S Carmack
text: Helpful staff who immediately helped me when I got to check out and saw that a barcode was missing on a product. Fixed in less than a minute. I appreciate that so much.

name: Jade Rice
text: Always friendly service here! Marsha is awesome!

name: TERRY GRANT
text: The people stocking the shelves do a fantastic job, the staff are usually very friendly and helpful when it comes to needing help finding items.

name: Patrick Bezotte (P.M Bezy)
text: Nice people staff was very helpful

name: Donice Ortiz
text: I went as soon as the store opened and it was only a few people inside.  So I felt safe shopping.  Store was clean and well stocked.

name: Christopher Hall
text:
I was a big fan of this place when they were 24 hours. Now i prefer krogers. They open at 7 and close at ~8-10. Between the oblivious patrons blocking the path, the 'buy me' displays everywhere and the daytime stocking carts it's very frustrating just to move around in the store. There is no room. This isn't the employee's fault as employee's aren't displays or stocking carts. This is a managerial fault. Have daytime stocking or 'buy me' displays. Don't clutter the aisles with both. If I had to sum up my review it's just 'store very cluttered'.

I don't have the same frustrations moving around in other grocery stores. This is a walmart specific problem.

name: Rob Smith
text: The pharmacists are Top notch!!  Super patient and willing to listen to you.   Cannot praise enough!

name: Stan S
text: Convenient location good selection of food. Good to pick up items on the way!

name: Neat lawn
text: All the workers are nice n wear a smile

name: Mona French
text: Very clean store , very helpful staff!

name: Travis Trip
text: Stop tracking me stalking weirdos.

name: Rebecca Ricks
text: Nice, clean, friendly customer service.

name: Rex Kirkpatrick
text: Good store. Usually have what I want/ need. One minor gripe. The one way aisles really don't have a pattern. In my opinion, just open up the aisles and let people go in both directions. It is not a busy store and the chances of contact are minimal. Just my opinion

name: Jenny Childers
text: Staff that were busy filling the shelves were all nice and helpful

name: Joni Graley
text: I love getting in and out of the store for a few items or a cart full. This Walmart offers that. Also the prices far outweigh my local Walmart.

name: Scott Mitchell
text: Always have what I need and always greeted by people who enjoy where they work

name: Gina Mardos
text: Such friendly staff, my favorite place for groceries!

name: Sonia Latham
text: Easy to run in and out. Favorite place to get groceries.

name: Jason O'Neal
text: I was skeptical of online grocery ordering but i had an amazing experience with grocery pick up with associate SHANICIA.  Her smile and her customer service were out of this world.  I will definitely be back to use the online grocery because of this experience with her.  OUTSTANDING!!!

name: Lisa&jerry Towne
text: Love this store

name: Stacey O.
text: All of the employees were wearing masks, sanitizing wipes were available at the entrance for the carts, and the store was well stocked other than the toilet paper.

name: Larry Smith
text: Nice store with easy access and close parking.

name: sheila simmons
text:
I will definitely be going back to this Walmart,  it was very well stocked, clean, and the employees were very friendly.
I was there around 10 am-11am.

name: lisa clardy
text: Usually I have great pick-up service at Wal-Mart, the past 2 to 3 weeks have let me down.  I’m having to wait long times for my order, 15 minutes or more, and I’m missing items on my list without being told or when substituting items I’m not getting the correct quantity.  This used to be an excellent service, please fix it.

name: Michael Thornton
text: This location is nice clean and most importantly WHITE 😁 and wonderful just like me!

name: Dawn Kimball
text: Well stocked way better than those on the northbside

name: Brandi S. Johnson
text: This location always has everything you need. Love the pickup staff, so friendly!

name: Sara Hardin
text: Good store to run in , I won't say quick and easy bc its always packed.. If your not doing a big grocery shopping,  it's perfect

name: Johnna Hall Miller
text: All staff members in this store have always been so kind and helpful!  Shout out and kudos to one of their most caring and kind cashiers, Crystal Stipe!!  God bless this sweet girl!!  I was shopping last night and, out of the blue as is soooooo common with severe vertigo, I went into a panic attack and was almost in tears as I raced to the front of the store to check out and leave, and that sweet girl immediately noticed something was wrong.  I told her I was just trying to check out quickly because I was on the verge of a severe panic attack, and she raced around to me and put her arms around me and spoke the sweetest, kindest words, and I knew she was a gift straight from God!!  She checked me out and had me take a seat on the bench right up front and across from her checkout line, and just kept talking to me in between her other customers.  GIVE THAT GIRL A PROMOTION AND A RAISE!!

name: K. Allen Mills
text: Just go elsewhere. Was a genuinely unpleasant shopping experience.

name: Pat McNeill
text: All employees very nice & helpful.  Not crowded.  Thank u WALMART

name: Kevin Burrows
text: Small can shop quick and friendly

name: Chase McClure
text: Easy in and out

name: Ken Hall
text: Plenty of helpful associates, well orgsnized crowd control and flow.

name: Jeremy West
text: Customer service still paralyzed by Covid mania protocols

name: Sharron Lamb
text: I went there for a interview.  I got there early. I asked for Beth she said she would be right there. I sat and waited a hour and 1/2 and she was over in produce working. Finally she comes.I thought she was very rude. She told me that she was doing interviews. I applied for deli and she still hasnt hired anyone. Waste of my time

name: Richard Bawcom
text: Great store and great employes

name: Nikki Burch
text: I would love to thank Jay for the best customer service experience I have ever had anywhere. Especially for giving me such a quick and easy item return experience, and for treating me more like a friend first and a customer second.

name: Ronald Bunner
text: Easy shopping but ALL customers must wear masks.

name: Wanda Gibbons
text: Always find what I need and the customer service is always great!!

name: Keith Ward

name: Danielle Lowery
text: I prefer going to Neighborhood Market over a super Walmart anyday! The staff at this particular location are wonderful!

name: Aaron Crawford
text: Neat and clean. This walmart is the nicest I've ever visited. Gives publix some competition.

name: Tami Bobicz-Bachelder
text: I really like this store much better than the super centers, especially if you're just needing grocery items. I LOVE there budget saver popsicles- banana flavor. However my regular wal mart on south Memorial parkway hardly ever has them. Butt I can always count on this location to have just what I need and more. I would definitely recommend taking time out to go and check out this Market, is well worth it!

name: Chris Beale
text: Great option to grab groceries in your neighborhood without having to visit one of Walmart superstores. These markets also have gas stations which adds to their convenience. The market does not have as many food selections as their larger stores do, but the selection is still surprisingly good. They also have a pharmacy which is another added convenience.

name: Amy Oaks
text: I will miss this store as I have moved to KCMO

name: Jason Harrell
text: Good

name: Christina Shore
text: The people who work there are so polite and courteous

name: Robert Karma
text: It's easy to get into this Walmart, find what you need, and check out. Much quicker than going to the regular Walmart.

name: Rhonda Sandlin
text: The experience was excellent - response time, accuracy, and friendliness. It is strange there is no cover for the cars here. Employees have to walk farther than at other locations and they may get soaked as well.

name: John Rea
text: Great service and shopping

name: Scott Allman
text: Certainly, the first ‘grocery only’ Walmart I’ve ever been in. It’s clean. Service actually seems a bit better than a typical Walmart. For one thing, this location always seems to have multiple checkout lanes open. I can’t say as much for most Walmart Supercenters where they have 20+ isles and only 2 are usually open. Perhaps, Walmart is learning something from this ‘Market’ archetype?

name: Dave Butler
text: Great store. The staff are tentative and friendly.

name: Jeremy Schmit
text: Just like any other walmart, but strunk. LOVE this place. Super convient to my home and great selection for the size building they have. Highly recommend.

name: Peter McDonald
text: The customer service was amazing. Had a nice person help me find everything I needed as well as gave suggest for certain food flavors.

name: Joyce Drach
text: Very convenient, clean and friendly store.

name: mario
text: It an ok place to stop bye get gas, buy a fee items on the go, safe and clean. They have the online order service and your groceries can be brought to your car.

name: Megan Marr
text: Bethany is a gem. Her and people like her are the reason I'm passing publix to purchase my goods. I've never visited a Walmart or neighborhood store that was so intune with their customers.

name: Brad OBarr
text: Typically I'm pleased with this place, choosing it over the other supercenters. However, the last few times they have not been stocked. I'm also learning of a few grocery items that are only available at the supercenters.

name: ray lindsey
text: I prefer the Neighborhood Walmart over the local super center. Easier to navigate, cleaner and well laid out - particularly for the groceries. The staff is friendlier and the customers more polite. You won't see many oddball people here. There are a few items that I will still go to the super center to purchase but that will be on an exception basis.

name: Mike Sparkman
text: Love the Neighborhood Market. Very different shopping experience from a Supercenter.

name: Mark Saint
text: Great staff, clean store a definite plus for folks who live in the area.

name: Zeke H
text: Good shopping carts and the produce section was much better than the Super Walmart on Sutton Rd. I will definitely go back on shopping days.

name: Amanda Moore
text: Clean store. Kind staff. They were reorganizing their beer section on 5-7-19, and the aisle was pretty much closed. The did offer to bring me what I needed off the aisle.

name: Haley *
text: Great little Walmart with all my needs! They even have a nice makeup section! Friendly workers too!

name: Susan DuPre'
text: Really like the layout of the store and all the options to choose from. Parking lot is easy to get in and out of. Staff is kind, cheerful, and helpful. Grocery pick up has been a lifesaver on more than one occasion! This store actually drew me away from Aldi!

name: Michael Norton
text: Good groceries

name: Susan Duthie
text: It's a good size for me to get around quickly.  The staff is very helpful if I ever need any help.  And, it is the only store where I enjoy self checkout.

name: Kathleen Makovicka
text: There was a girl there that was incredibly helpful. I wish more people were like her. Great personality and genuine

name: Mary Ellen Millbranth
text: Very nice neighborhood store.  Staff actually walks you to the spot when you ask them where something is.  Pretty amazing.  On the other hand, while they have a lots of fresh produce, they have little to no vegetarian and vegan products except some tofu and a small freezer section though they have a large gluten-free section.  I would love to see them bring more health food items in.

name: Donna Woods
text: Always well stock clean and very friendly employees

name: Gwyn Williams
text: Great place to shop!  Friendly staff.  Fresh produce.

name: The Woke Unicorn
text: Great place to do some quick grocery shopping, or other household and personal items.

name: Jacob Olival
text: This is my store. I love the staff here. Every one of them is super friendly and they always have what I need. Awesome place to shop.

name: Linda Foote
text: I enjoy shopping here regularly. It is a great outing for me. And they seem to be improving the vegetable selection and quality all the time.

name: Connie Heike
text: I found everything I needed  but the vegetables that I bought for my salad wasnt the best  looking and neither was the cucumbers.

name: Kreigan Hopkins (Antherian)
text: This store is awesome, really nice staff here. My GF and I went for a walk around our neighborhood, and this Walmart is right down the street. We brought a few dollars to get my GF a snack during the walk. We ended up being 6 cents short, and Diamond in the self checkout isle paid for the rest.

name: Paul Hanson
text: Staff. Are very friendly and helpful..

name: Sharon Cowan
text: Great place to pick up a few quick groceries and don't want to do a lot of walking.

name: Donovan Williams
text: Best neighborhood market in the area with the best grocery pickup in the state.

name: Allison Pence
text: Love this place when i don't want to go in the bigger walmarts this is the place i go

name: David Stanford
text: Employees were great im seriously agrevated because I've not received any of my gift cards aor valtures from you so i guess it's ok when you can't purchase anything

name: Angela Swain
text: Love to shop here!  VERY good produce at the right price,  and helpful people.  Can't beat the pick up service!

name: Laura Yates
text: I love grocery pick up. Ordering from the app saves so much time. I would give them five stars but they are frequently out of things I buy often. That almost never happens at the supercenter on South parkway. The Market is more convenient so I take my chances. You don't always know if something is out of stock until you arrive.

name: Aaron Lutz
text: Very good Wal-Mart to get food items from. They also have gas you can get there to! The staff were overwhelming nice about asking if I needed help. I didn't like the parking set up. I did like how all the food is organized and easily accessible. If you use there app it's even easier to find items that you want or need.

name: Bill Beckum
text:
Nice clean store with good people working in it.
Things have changed, maybe they all had a bad day today but I'm a Target customer until further notice. If they don't want to work here they should do something else not punish me with their attitude problem.

name: Mark Brown
text: Great

name: Sharon Cowan
text: Great place to pick up a few quick groceries and don't want to do a lot of walking.

name: Donna Woods
text: Always well stock clean and very friendly employees

name: Reba Reid
text: It's like a neighborhood grocery store. Don't have to walk in your legs off to do your shopping. Neat and organized. Love their product displays. Wine selection is good and the prices are best.

name: Pat Garrett
text: Monica Garrett made my day awesome her friendly smile and vast knowledge.saved the day for my cookout.

name: Donovan Williams
text: Best neighborhood market in the area with the best grocery pickup in the state.

name: Paul Hanson
text: Staff. Are very friendly and helpful..

name: Dana Wright- Dempsey
text: Excellent, and I don't use that word lightly to describe, customer service. They are the friendlies and most helpful staff.   You won't believe it is associated with Wal-Mart.  I've yet to be in the store when I wasn't asked by at least two people if I needed assistance. Even the pharmacy is super kind and efficient.  I love the pick up service, even in the rain they greeted me, insisted I stay in car, and marked the fragile items like bread and eggs. I am impressed with this store and the associates that work at the Neighborhood Market. I can't say enough to relay how great this store and how happy they are in our community.

name: Michelle Huskey
text: Everyone is very helpful and courteous!! I go 3 times a week  and have always been very happy with the store and employees!

name: Kimberly Cox
text: No casher everything in the way stocking shelf

name: david williams
text: Fresh produce and convient

name: Michelle Huskey
text: Everyone is very helpful and courteous!! I go 3 times a week  and have always been very happy with the store and employees!

name: Paul Carlton
text: Great store for quick pickup's.

name: Steven Smith
text: Pam in the self check out was extremely rude and unpleasant.

name: Kathleen Nordmann
text:
The best Walmart and Pharmacy in town. The whole store goes out of its way to make you feel like it your special store. The Pharmacy goes out of it way to keep your Rx current and filled even if you forget, including calls so that you have all your meds.
Thanks Walmart, you're welcome to our neighborhood.

name: Brian Tanner
text: They have redbone it looks great

name: Mona Lee
text: Went later at night and was more satisfied as far as what I went in for.

name: Dana Wright- Dempsey
text: Excellent, and I don't use that word lightly to describe, customer service. They are the friendlies and most helpful staff.   You won't believe it is associated with Wal-Mart.  I've yet to be in the store when I wasn't asked by at least two people if I needed assistance. Even the pharmacy is super kind and efficient.  I love the pick up service, even in the rain they greeted me, insisted I stay in car, and marked the fragile items like bread and eggs. I am impressed with this store and the associates that work at the Neighborhood Market. I can't say enough to relay how great this store and how happy they are in our community.

name: April Baker
text: I love this place! Super convenient and the only Walmart in the world where the employees are actually nice AND helpful, too (just guessing cause obviously I haven't been to all of them, LOL) Love it!

name: Eric Fullerton
text: I had to visit this Walmart because I'd never been to a "Neighborhood Market" branded Walmart before. It was super nice. More like a grocery store than a Walmart. Prices seemed very reasonable, if not on the low end. This is a nice Walmart for those looking for cheap groceries.

name: Nick Roth
text: I love the neighborhood markets, they are open 24 hours a day and you can get it and out very quickly. I'm surprised sometimes at what they do carry, but they definitely have limited stock of your typical home goods. For example, this store seems to stock extension cables, air filters, car oil, etc. Essentials that you might need to grab quickly when you are getting groceries.

name: Johnny Orren
text: Always clean

name: E- Man
text: Great service on par with the Walmart Supercenter at Drake and Memorial Parkway. Contrary to what I have heard, the prices are the same.

name: Corey Atkins
text: Very respectful and humble staff.Mark Christy and Montero are always being patient and very respectful.Somtimes I notice some unique customers. But they are great regardless.

name: NeetarNeet
text: Good selection, well stocked, clean, bright. Actually had a real person working the register.

name: Scott Jeter
text: New grocery store format. Compact layout. Reasonable selection. No electronics or toys to sidetrack and lose time on.

name: marie hill
text: Clean, well stocked, helpful staff. Far better than the Hampton Cove one. The Drake one is a nightmare!

name: Paul Davoren
text: By far the best walmart store I have been to.  Staff is always friendly and helpful, store is always clean and aisles uncluttered.

name: Liss Sterling
text: Great store: clean, friendly, pretty. The staff is always so friendly and cheerful. They bend over backwards to make sure you are cared for. If only the Wal-Mart Superstores could generate this level of customer service, I'd shop there, too.

name: Kathy Lamb
text: Nice and clean

name: kelly robinson
text: It's clean with a wide selection and I love being able to pre order my groceries and set and set up a pick up date and time. They just bring it right out to the car when you arrive.  Everything is easy to find in the store and the associates are very friendly. The only problem I have is the fact that The parking lot is a little confusing

name: Christie Chamberlain
text: Over all it's a nice store but one thing I HATE about all Walmarts there is never enough register's open. An people are always lined up .But they are pretty good if they see people lined up some one will open an lane to run a few people through .

name: Zed Linger
text: It's OK. If it wasn't owned by the greedy Walton family I'd go there again but I was just there to grab a drink and wait for an Uber home from the doctor's office next door

name: Henry Held
text: Self checkout lanes are open almost all the time and it's new so I like it... some prices are more expensive than a regular superwalmart like milk but overall a quick in and out compared to a regular walmart

name: John OBryan
text: No cashiers....

name: Debra McNutt
text: So much easier than going to the Super center....i love it

name: Stedjuthan
text: I go here nearly weekly and the staff have always been helpful, kind and welcoming!

name: Dorothy Campbell
text: Had what I needed.

name: J C
text: Average smaller walmart grocery store with gas station. Clean.

name: David Hayes
text: It's Wal-Mart, but the staff is really what makes it pleasant.

name: No one Important
text: I may be partial to this location because it is within walking distance....but I am at this Walmart about once a day (at least) & the people are always very helpful and friendly....the night staff especially. They are always so sweet to my kid too!

name: Melanie Teal
text: Love this new little Wal-Mart. Fast and easy. Good for a fast dash or full grocery shopping. Also has free pickup!

name: Mark Johnson
text: These folks are awesome. Mark is a night manager and his crew is phenomenal. Glad I'm a friend. And they will order what you need if it isn't in stock.

name: Heath Varmette
text: Very helpful staff!

name: Teresa White
text: This store is so clean and everyone is helpful.  I enjoy shopping here for meat and fresh vegetables.

name: Peter F.
text: The neighborhood market it's very convenient, the employees are friendly and helpful. It's generally well staffed and quick even when busy, something that can't be said for all Walmart's.

name: Lori Reliford
text: Nice store

name: Kiel Pease
text: Excellent grocery pick up service. The associate  came out to my wife's car in the pouring rain to load her groceries in the trunk. We were very appreciative.

name: Scott Smith
text: They actually have food stocked with selections and never as crowded as the super Wal Mart next to my houe.  Worth the 10 min. drive.

name: Cathy Best
text: Friendly service. A joy to shop there. Has a lot of what I need and is convenient.

name: keltin2002
text: Nice store but the clientelle in that area are self important heels. They'll run you over in the store with their buggies or in the parking lot with their cars. It's upper middle class there, but the the general self importance and disregard for courteousy is way above their station, and polite society in general. But the store itself is clean, well stocked, easy to navigate and check out.

name: Ryan Robley
text: Friendly and helpful staff. Clean, well stocked and always a pleasant experience.

name: Joseph R. Huneycutt III
text: 95% of  my grocery list

name: james adams
text: A better than average walmart. Very clean good variety and well stocked.

name: D Jeana
text: Some workers here are very nice. Some are so rude for no reason. They never have much in stock. The store is always clean. But they could work on customer service.

name: Douglas Meeks
text: I never go to the grocery store anymore they put everything in the car and I ordered all online did you just doesn't get any better

name: paul Kiczuk
text: Clean, friendly staff, very nice laid back atmosphere, and best of all... The deli has Land O Lakes American cheese!!!!! Hard to find down here. Our ONLY grocery store from now on!

name: D Brooks
text:
They are so friendly! The Wal-Mart neighborhood market team members from produce to pharmacy departments are always helpful!  The only negative is registers as with most Wal-Mart stores they have 20 registers and only two cashier's. They always have plenty of self checkouts but they could use carousel bagging if we're having to check ourselves out one bag at a time just won't do.
... Thanks

name: Daniel Lee Hogan
text: This is a very clean, organized, and well stocked grocery store. However, your not going to find all the processed junk food. I was impressed by the amount of healthy, organic, gluten free, Non GMO products they are carrying. Convenient, lots of parking, and it's not really a high traffic area although the rush hour traffic can spill over. Also I believe they have online shopping. Not surprising because think about it. Wal Mart was, is, and more than likely will continue to be a game changer.

text: Super clean and a very quiet Wal-Mart, which is quite unsusal for any Wal-Mart these days. Always stocked well and very friendly associates. The gentlemen who runs the fuel center and convenient part, is extremely friendly and kind. He normally works most mornings and it's always a pleasure to see him. He is doing an excellent job managing that part of the business, which is also unusual for Wal-Mart to have such a well kept manager.

This store never has their chit together. Cookies are ALWAYS broken , if they have any. Very minimal selection compared to other Wal-Mart stores. Last visit, they had plastic covering ALL of the meat coolers as if it was all tainted or not for sale. No bueno.
Wife and I went in to grab some wine and champagne. The cashier asked to see BOTH of our ID's. We're both well over 30 years old. Often there are times where one of us doesn't have our id handy. Luckily we both had it on hand. Otherwise, the party would've been dry! This place sucks!

name: Kaitlin Miller
text: I was told by a worker named “kaykay” who says she is an assistant manager that I could not return something I bought the day before with my receipt. She told me she couldn’t return it without the manager there but she was an assistant manager. I use to work at this store so I know that if she is who she says she is she can return it. She then goes to say well I’ll try, but then she looks at my receipt and said she couldn’t return it because I used the smart coupons. My mother is a assistant manager at another Family Dollar and she told me that was a lie. So I asked for her name because she had no name tag on, she proceeds to say her name is “kaykay” so I asked for her real name and she would not give it to me. So I left and went to the Family Dollar on hwy 150 and returned it with no problem. This place is a joke ever since the last manager left.

name: Vanessa skripko
text: They hardly ever actually open at 8 the sign is there, but doors are locked. Big puddles of water coming out the back every time I go, absolutely no wet floor signs (not sure it would help the water is ankle deep). There is new product to be put out blocking aisles you will want to shop, it is there for days like they don't have the staff for it. Most items out of stock and their refrigerator reads 61 which is terrible food temperatures.

name: Valerie Gaines
text: The aisles are really crowded with merchandise to put out. The back of the store had a water leak from somewhere all over the floor and had a bad odor.  Only one cashier was working at the time. She was in great spirits and had awesome customer service skills. I didn't get her name but she was a black older lady with glasses and mingled gray hair. The store needs more committed employees with better pay. The turnover rate is extremely high, there are constant new employees.

name: Kevin Thompson
text: Now, who does not like Dollar General?  No one ever, AND if you are in Hepzibah and you suddenly have a great need for some diaper rash medecine or diapers or cat litter or a toilet plunger, well what would you do without this Dollar General?  You would be in DEEP DOO DOO.  Yep, you would be driving forever down the road cuz you are a long way from everything down here.  This place is awesome, an oasis in this little country community.  OK, this is one of those heavy use locations that they can not stock and clean as fast as the country folk buy it up and track in mud.  If I was a cashier I would put summa y'all in yo place too.  Stop in and get some of those peanuts too, the best ever.

name: Pamela Lee
text: Please be sure and watch carefully when trying to use coupons or get your $5.00 a week off. I think I have it figured out, and then get up to the register to only find out they add some discounts in BEFORE the tax is added, the it does not add up to $25.00, so you don't get the additional $5.00 off. When you're stuck in line, with alot of people behind you, you're on the hook to just pay and leave. They do not help you with this either, and most times the buy so much, get so much off does not work at checkout, and 9 times out of 10, the sale prices are not marked in the store,  so you don't even know you're getting them until you look at your ticket.  It takes alot of work and time to save money at Dollar General using the app coupons. If you can figure it out, it might be worth it, but be careful, you will end up spending far more than you want to, and that's no deal !!!!

name: notthebeesxoxo
text: The people are amazing, always nice, the store is always organized without any issues. But within the last few months, their ac has been broken and they will not fix it. They are forcing their employees to work in a building that is hotter than 90° and only giving them little fans to cool them off. Within 5 mins of being in the store, I was sweating. I am here all the time and have noticed over months that nothing is being done. Until you guys fix your air and prove to your employees that you care about them and their health, I won't be back. And I will make sure the many people I know who live in this area know how your employees are treated. This is disgusting. Wrong. Unethical. I could go on. What's crazy is they have 3 signs up saying they need managers, stockers and cashier's. I WONDER WHY. Paying employees $7.25 to stand in 90° weather. Despicable!!!

name: Anna Beavers
text:
We live right around the corner from this Dollar Tree.
We are remodeling our home ourselves and therefore we visit the store several times a week. Every employee knows our names and they are quick to help us out in any way possible.
But it's not just us, every employee always has a smile for every customer, and they go out of their way to help find something that a customer may be looking for.
They should all get an A + for customer service and knowledge of their store.

I have been to other Dollar Tree stores, and I was disappointed in the customer service, as there was none. The employees were standing around, obviously supposed to be working, and after standing in line for several minutes, with no acknowledgement from any employee, I asked to be checked out, and the MANAGER sighed and acted like she was doing me a favor by ringing me up.
As insulting as that was, there was an employee leaning on the customer side of the register, and he had a Mountain Dew, and she rang him up before me. He realized that he didn't have any money, and the MANAGER was about to void it out, and I smiled and said," I'll pay for it."
Needless to say, I will never go back to the Pelham Dollar Tree again.

I pointed that out to say this, you will NEVER find employees hanging around at the Valleydale store. If they are at work, they are working.
If they are stocking the aisles and they notice a line forming, someone will run and open another register.
After being in the retail sales business for over 30 years, I can honestly say that I would hire your entire team.

text: Well, I have a lot to say about this specific location, most likely too much for this review so I'll just sum it up, I bought a bluetooth speaker (25 bucks) unboxed it and realized only one speaker (out of two) was working, so I decided to try and return it and exchange it for a different one, (mind you, this all happened within 5 hours and I had the receipt) after explaining to the manager what this speaker was not doing (working) she pointed at a sign behind me and said sorry we have a no return policy, I explained I just wanted to exchange it for a different one and I showed receipt, nonetheless, she refused to accept a broken product this store sold me, and said they had a no return policy on everything, so went to another location and with ease after explaining the situation, manager did the exchanged with no issues. So avoid this unprofessional hippocratic people at all cost, they try and screw you at any chance they get. I don't know the manager s name who refused to take back a broken product, but will be finding it and reporting it to corporate and others soon. She was a Hispanic or Chinese lady with glasses. Avoid this store at all costs.

text: Visiting from out of state and stopped here since it was close to where we were staying.  I have never been in a more nastier DG than this one.  Stock bins lined the back wall to where I had to pick up the back end of my buggy to turn a corner. The Christmas aisle was in such disarray with items all over the floor. Had to wait and let other customers go first because the aisles were so packed with stock bins.  Not a lot of product on the shelves.No light is the refrigerated section. I gave it 1 star because I had to. Manager needs to get a grip or seek employment elsewhere.

text:
This is a typical Dollar General. You aren't going to get stellar service or anything like that. It was clean, and well stocked which is all most people need.

I didn't much care for waiting at the register for several minutes because all employees were in the back. When one finally came out, she glanced at me and said, "Someone will be out to help you in bit" and walked away, to (apparently) browse the store shelves.

Worth noting: if you use your debit card and opt to receive cash back, they will charge you an extra $1.50 in convenience fees.

text: People should stop in and have a look around ill show a few pictures from the store in athens, but it isn't everything. You'll just have to come and see it for yourself. name: Shanna Keezer
text: My husband and I went here to look at flooring for our house. They had advertised they had deals online.  They had outdoor furniture outside that was completely filthy.  The merchandise at the front of the store was well organized but it was all the same price or higher than what we had priced at Home Depot. I didn't see anything I would consider a discount.  About halfway through the store, we were approached by a rather large man who kind of barked at us, "What are you looking for?"  We told him that we came to look at flooring, but were browsing to see what else they had.  He proceeded to closely follow us through the store, not talking, just standing with his arms crossed watching us.  My husband and I got so creeped out we just left.  I was really glad I didn't go in there by myself.
